7.  Leaving out how or whether justices were interviewed was a stunning gap.  They ultimately had to backfill, which they did very vaguely, but why the flinch in the first place? Are the justices made of spun sugar and vulnerable to breakage?

6.  Despite failing to identify a suspect, the Court suggests a motive — “attempt at protest” — that imputes the leak to the liberal chambers. Real investigations don’t do that. Just as likely, it came from other chambers with the motive to pin down soft votes.

5.  It is not clear that records were kept of statements of the justices. Investigation 101 is to take down witness statements (a) so there is no question later about what was said and (b) so any wrongfully false statements can be prosecuted. That’s SOP.

4.  It is not clear that all suspects were interviewed.  What was the undisclosed “iterative” process with the justices? It does not sound like an investigative interview when the subject is asking questions.
3.  Chertoff is riddled with disqualifying conflicts of interest that a real investigation would avoid (served with Alito, works for Court).
2.  I’ve never seen an investigation that had a third party riding along in a sidecar (Chertoff) to say it was a good investigation. Weird.

Today’s announcement shows that promises made have been promises kept. In Washington, no one thought “infrastructure week” would ever get done. But we made it happen – and now it’s not just a week, it’s moving our nation forward for the next decade.

This project is also expected to create 30,000 good-paying jobs. From local workforce development to apprenticeship programs to project labor agreements between Amtrak and NABTU – we’re making sure the community and our unions are involved and no one is left behind.

The B&P tunnel replacement is also a game changer for MARC and Amtrak commuters & one example of how we're acting on our promise to improve public transit through our infrastructure modernization law. Now, riders can expect faster commutes, greater safety, and more reliability.

By replacing the B&P tunnel we’re cutting the transit time from DC to Baltimore down to just 30 minutes and expanding capacity at the Port of Baltimore. That means more business, more opportunity, and more prosperity for Charm City.

This new tunnel, which will be renamed after one of Maryland's greatest sons, Frederick Douglass, will replace the B&P tunnel which is the oldest in the ENTIRE Amtrak system and has been around since the days of Ulysses S. Grant's presidency!

You know it’s going to be a good week when it starts with @POTUS joining us to announce major news for MD! It’s impossible to overstate what a big deal this is: these $$ from the infrastructure modernization law to replace the B&P tunnel mean big opportunity for our state.🧵 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FnxAr3mXoAAwGuD.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FnxAr3jWIAAE_gp.jpg
